DocAttribute.Name: ApplicableDates
DocAttribute.Documentation:
Defines an ordered list of the dates for which the time-series data are applicable. For example, the definition of all public holiday dates for a given year allows the formulation of a "holiday" occupancy schedule from overall occupancy data. Local time can be used if the dates are not bound to a particular year.
> <font color="#FF0000" size="-1">IFC2x2 Addendum 1 change: The attribute has been changed to be optional </font>

DocAttribute.Name: TimeSeriesScheduleType
DocAttribute.Documentation: Defines the type of schedule, such as daily, weekly, monthly or annually.

DocAttribute.Name: TimeSeries
DocAttribute.Documentation: The time series is used to represent the values at discrete points in time that define the schedule. For example, a 24-hour occupancy schedule would be a regular time series with a start time at midnight, end time at (the following) midnight, and with 24 values indicating the occupancy load for each hour of the 24-hour period.

DocWhereRule.Name: WR41
DocWhereRule.Documentation: The type of IfcTimeSeriesSchedule shall be given by inherited attribute ObjectType, if the enumeration value in TimeSeriesScheduleType is set to USERDEFINED.
